action.action-desc: Mr. Carson of Indiana introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To require institutions of higher education to provide students with information from the Occupational Employment Statistics program and the Occupational Outlook Handbook of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Higher Education and Employment Transparency Act.

subsection.header: Requirements for the Secretary of Education
subsection.text: Section 132(i)(1) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1015a(i)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (V), by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: Employment information with respect to graduates of the institution’s degree or certificate programs that is required to be provided by the institution under section 485(a)(R).

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (W), by inserting before the period at the end the following: and a link to the appropriate section of such website that provides information from the Occupational Employment Statistics program and the Occupational Outlook Handbook of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

subsection.header: Requirements for institutions of higher education

paragraph.header: Institutional and financial assistance information for students
paragraph.text: Section 485(a)(R) of such Act (20 U.S.C. 1092(a)(R)) is amended by inserting after certificate programs, the following: including whether such employment is paid or unpaid and whether such employment requires any postsecondary education,.
Section 487(a) of such Act (20 U.S.C. 1094(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

The institution will provide a link on the institution’s website, prominently and near any institutional statistics (such as job placement rates), to the appropriate section of the Bureau of Labor Statistics website that provides information from the Occupational Employment Statistics program and the Occupational Outlook Handbook of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall be effective for academic year 2015–2016 and succeeding academic years.
